suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Tighten library-worker and docs-worker skill procedures around verification: workers should either run full-suite `bun run test` or explicitly document in their handoff deviations why they skipped it (e.g., docs-only change). Currently workers mark followedProcedure=true while only running package-level tests, which makes compliance tracking unreliable.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: fix-dx-scanner-and-env handoff ran only package-level tests (bun test --filter=outfitter, bun test --filter=@outfitter/testing) instead of full-suite. fix-migration-docs-accuracy handoff ran only lint. Both marked followedProcedure=true with no deviations.

rejectedObservations.observation: Mission AGENTS.md still documents stale pre-existing testCommand env-cleanup behavior (process.env[key] = undefined vs delete)
rejectedObservations.reason: Mission-specific context managed by the orchestrator, not shared state.

rejectedObservations.observation: Mission features.json still states codemod transforms to .handler().context() vs actual .action()
rejectedObservations.reason: Mission-specific metadata inconsistency, not shared state. Already resolved at source code level.

rejectedObservations.observation: services.yaml still lists `bun run check` which crashes
rejectedObservations.reason: Pre-existing repo-level issue documented in mission AGENTS.md. services.yaml reflects the canonical repo command; the crash is a known oxfmt bug.
